intro: Serjania nodosa, commonly known as the Brazilian hibiscus or red hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. Serjania nodosa thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
